info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 3:12PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms with heavy rain and gusty winds will impact portions of Central Massachusetts and Central Connecticut through 415 PM... At 310 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ludlow Massachusetts south to near Newington Connecticut. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rainfall and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Heavy rainfall will cause minor flooding in low lying and poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Hartford, New Britain, West Hartford, Manchester, East Hartford, Enfield, Glastonbury, Newington, Vernon, Windsor, Wethersfield, Mansfield, South Windsor, Ludlow, Bloomfield, Berlin, Rocky Hill, Longmeadow and Suffield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.
